course.subject: MARK
course.name: Services Marketing
course.description: The development of marketing strategy for a variety of service businesses including: the traditional marketing mix (4 P's) and the management of the service encounter, i.e., the interface between the service firm and the consumer.

reviews.author: terenceeee
reviews.title: not bad
reviews.comment_content: It is about how a service company attract customers by different ways.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is boring and useless. Although there are some blanks in the ppt, you will get the full version before the quiz.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fine. The project is easy to get a good mark. The quiz includes MC and LQ. I got a B when most of the things got above 1 sd.
reviews.comment_workload: Normal marketing course. A project with presentation and final report, 2 quiz, 8 short assignments but require case study. If your group has more people then your project will be easier.

reviews.author: avv
reviews.title: Prof not good
reviews.comment_content:
It teaches about different topics under services marketing and there is a strong emphasis on the GAPS model, i.e gaps from the provider while providing a service and customer gap. It's pretty bullshit in my opinion.

IF you see this professor next semester, I'd advice you not to take it.  This course despite what the prof conveys, is all about memorization.

The components are:
2 midterm exams
Participation/ Attendance
Presentation
Report
Marketing Experiments
reviews.comment_teaching:
The prof name is Qiang Zhang and he is a new professor, fresh out of PhD and has limited teaching experience in NTU, if I am not wrong.

His teaching is quite mediocre, speaks with a thick Mainland accent and delivery poor. His voice may make you feel disinterested and use your phone or laptop to pass time. I would say he is quite committed in the sense that he would send regular mails on what would be covered in the next class and immediately reply to mails regarding any questions about the course.

The regular mails started to get annoying tho after sometime. The analogies he comes up with while teaching are quite senseless and irritating at worst.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading fucking sucks. The exams are a mix of short answers and MCQs, so the short answers can be answered in a variety of ways, yet the professor grades according to what he thinks is 'right' and claims that it follows the service marketing principles.

A lot of people had issues with how he graded it and were trying to get extra points by justifying their answers.

The other components such as the presentation, report and participation, I am not too sure as he didn't release the grades for those, but I think most people may have got similar scores.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is OK. Not high, but not low. You are expected to read a case every week as he would go through the case in class and you'll need to answer questions on a worksheet which will be distributed in class.

It's good to read the cases in advance and pay attention to them so that you can answer some of the questions in the exam as they are tested.

The project will take some to complete and better to start early before you get busy with other courses. It is a service audit where you select a company and investigate the services they are providing and try to find out what gaps exist in their service.

This project will involve primary and secondary research, finding information online about the company, conducting interviews with customers, focus groups, interviewing the staff/ managers, and observing the place where the service takes place. You'll need to apply the concepts learnt in class to support research and finally present your findings in a in class presentation and a report.

reviews.author: Majaiiiii
reviews.comment_content: There is a clear flow of content which makes the course easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very nice that he organized a Haodilao gathering for all the students during the term. He used a lot of videos and examples to help illustrate the theories but he may put some of this extra information on the quiz paper.
reviews.comment_grading: His quiz paper questions are very straightforward so it is quite easy to achieve a good result and he is a lenient marker.
reviews.comment_workload: There is quite a lot of work for this course, including one 5 to 6 pages long self-reflection, one mini case study on top of quizzes and project but the work is not really difficult and the professor is sometimes willing to postpone the deadline if you request beforehand with valid reasons.

reviews.author: jthwongaa
reviews.comment_content:
The course aims to provide students with understanding of how to evaluate services.
Attendance is required, scores will be awarded for answering questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is superb as he is very friendly and funny and could always make the lesson interesting by giving many examples.
reviews.comment_grading: Mid-term and Final scores same as mean, full attendance, Project score should be higher than mean, final grade B+
reviews.comment_workload: You are supposed to write a weekly journal after each lesson submit them towards the very end of the semester. Other than that, there is no homework/assignment.
